experience: You and David both know Bernard Ong, Mark McMorrine, and 63 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017
The average recruiter lives to age 48
Ok, maybe not dead.  But definitely burnt out.
There is no other profession where EVERY SINGLE ASPECT is a variable
You can do everything right, and still end up emptyhanded
“I know I was supposed to start tomorrow, but I haven’t told my wife yet.”
“That candidate was PERFECT.  Who else do you have?”
“You filled 3 jobs this week?  Great! But you only made 49 calls yesterday.  I’m sorry but this isn’t working out.”
Before you hang up that phone
Before you write that rude email
The recruiter you are talking to now is not the one that ghosted you last week
(and odds are they were crying 5 minutes ago)

Accomplished Database, Audit/Security and Availability leader with a stellar track record of driving organizational success for financial service companies.  Lead front-line engineering teams totaling 18 people in an environment where mistakes can mean a “Wall Street Journal” event and where audit failures visible to the CIO.  Develop people who are newer in their careers as well as those who are further along to take the next step.- Increase database team productivity by 40% (DB2 for z/OS, DB2 LUW, DB2 DBA and Datacom)- Led team as they provided level 2 and 3 technical support for operations in key outage or potential outage events- Led database team audit response to 13 audits in 2017 and 6 in 2016- Architected, developed and implemented a DB2 performance warehouse using Visual Studio and Shared Business Objects.   Warehouse is used to resolve problems, show trends and to easily identify application performance issues.

Diversified expertise into Smart Homes, green initiatives and Windows/SQL Server application development- Managed the project which implemented the technology for a model smart home- Managed the firms green initiatives including their wind energy program- Designed and implemented "Entitlement" application using Visual Studio and SQL Server which allowed the firm to track and allocate costs of converting raw land into commercial/residential property- Windows Server Administrator

Designed and implemented DB2 and associated supporting software. I provided level 2 and 3 support for complex systems. I conducted root cause analysis to identify, isolate, and remediate issues.  Successfully architected and coordinated a proof of concept that demonstrated that balance inquiry traffic could be replicated to and serviced on DB2 LUW servers with no customer impact using replication .

Member of core team which created the availability practice at Charles Schwab.  Technical crisis manager for many computing outage or potential outage situations.  Led support teams for DB2, CICS, IMS, MQ, Datacom, Storage and z/OS.

recommendations: Principal Enterprise Architect / Walmart Technology/ David Glass Technology Center
April 16, 2010, David worked with Luis in different groups

I had the privilege of working with Luis twice.  First when he worked for IBM I took a class he taught class on Parallel Sysplex Operations and Recovery.  Second, when I worked for JP Morgan Chase and he worked in the Architecture and Planning group.In both cases I found Luis to be an expert in Sysplex Technology and in applying that technology to efficiently address business issues.  He is a an extremely effective leader and this is leadership is demonstrated by the success of the projects he leads.  He is an outstanding communicator both verbally and in writing.  He thinks strategically and is able to lead the teams which implement his strategic vision.I highly recommend Luis.  He will be a great asset to any organization he joins.

summary: An IT Infrastructure Leader with a proven track record in demanding complex environments where mistakes can mean “Wall Street Journal” events and where Audit is a number one priority garnering the attention of the CIO.  Well versed in IT infrastructure having a reputation as a leader whose teams constantly expand their skills, take on more responsibility and deliver on their commitments.  A skilled mentor, objective setter, “fire fighter” and strategic thinker.  Enthusiastically embraces challenges and enjoys taking on new responsibilities.Areas of expertise include: 1) Database Engineering oversight; 2) Regulatory Compliance & Auditing Processes; 3) Data Security and Integrity; 4) Technical Team Development & Leadership and 5) Availability Management.  Examples of career accomplishments include:•	Led team to take on 40% more work with the same headcount; expanding the technologies the team supported while transitioning to 1/3 junior staff•	Leadership of audit response for all operational DBMS’ for a large online brokerage (Oracle, SQL, Mongo, DB2 for z/OS, DB2 LUW and Datacom)•	Led team of systems and applications DBA’s during crisis situations as the team provided both Level 2 and Level 3 support for technology operations.•	Achieved $300,000 savings by renegotiating one contractA leader who has embraced change throughout his career and who leads teams to do the same.  Demonstrated leadership in a wide variety of roles from availability management to leading green initiatives for real estate development company to database engineering management.  In 2017 broadened his own skills by completing a graduate certificate in Business Analytics and passing the Security+ certification exam.Technical Proficiencies: DB2 for z/OS, Oracle, SQL, DB2 LUW, IMS, z/OS, Linux/Unix, Crystal Reports, Advanced Excel ChartingCertifications:  ComptTIA Security+ : Oct. 19, 2017
name: David Price
title: IT Infrastructure Leader
